body: Thank you for reporting. I will look at this.

Hi @tqchen, could you please give some hints about this issue? Thanks a lot.
Here is the model structure.
https://github.com/R1ncy/MxnetStudy/blob/master/abcnn2.png
The attention matrix A is calculated with two feature maps of shared weight conv layers using cosine similarity. 
After that, calculate the row and col sum of A and do attention-based pooling.
In order to reduce the output dim of ABpolling, I extract k rows from its output(k_max_words_pooling). 

I debug these functions(similarity, ABpolling and k_max_words_pooling) separately and they run correctly.
But when I put them into these model, I get this Check failed error.

~~I've tried and the script runs well.~~ I'm using the latest dmlc/master. Also, I've compiled using the master version of nnvm + mshadow + dmlc-core
The script runs well on my windows build and stuck on my linux build...
Also, I've tried ThreadedEngine + ThreadedEnginePerDevice 
Log
```log
(C:\Anaconda2) D:\HKUST\mxnet\example\numpy-ops>python nnvm_customop_bug.py
[23:19:24] D:\HKUST\mxnet\src\io\iter_mnist.cc:91: MNISTIter: load 60000 images, shuffle=1, shape=(100,784)
[23:19:24] D:\HKUST\mxnet\src\engine\engine.cc:36: MXNet start using engine: ThreadedEnginePerDevice
[23:19:24] D:\HKUST\mxnet\src\io\iter_mnist.cc:91: MNISTIter: load 10000 images, shuffle=1, shape=(100,784)
WARNING:root:^[[91m[Deprecation Warning] mxnet.model.FeedForward has been deprecated. Please use mxnet.mod.Module instead.^[[0m
```

no
@tqchen

os.environ["MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS"] = "4"
Add this to the beginning before importing mxnet

We need to add this line to the beginning
 mxnet::op::RegisterLegacyOpProp();

may be this is related with this problem http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1312241/using-a-static-const-int-in-a-struct-class/1312267#1312267

I meet similar problem when I do amalgamation.

After I add const int64_t GraphStorageAllocator::kBadStorageID;  Everything is ok.
p100 requires cuda8.0, (also the corresponding cudnn with cuda8.0). besides, we need to add the flag `-gencode arch=compute_60,code=compute_60` for `CUDA_ARCH` defined in config.mk
duplicated to #4523
no. the reason is there are not so many identical numbers in the data, a general lossless compression is not efficient. but lossy compression such as quantization may work
which pre-trained model are you using. `20160531_win10_x64_cpu` is probably too old.
try a new win version at https://github.com/yajiedesign/mxnet/releases?
here is the link: https://github.com/yajiedesign/mxnet/releases

Oh okay, cool, no problem. I'll update you in case I happen to fix this bug first then yours.
Cheers :)
@miguelgfierro @thirdwing

see https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/4522

@piiswrong where to add?

@zhouphd  
I do not understand what you are doing
there are 2 option in MKL_README
1. mklmk + atlas
2. mkl full package
why you modify mshadow.mk to mklml?

It seems this function should be called  first
```
/*!
 * \brief list all the available operator names, include entries.
 * \param out_size the size of returned array
 * \param out_array the output operator name array.
 * \return 0 when success, -1 when failure happens
 */
MXNET_DLL int MXListAllOpNames(mx_uint *out_size,
                               const char ***out_array);
```
I'm not very clear about how to use this api, will this be ok?
```
int size;
char **out;
MXListAllOpNames(&size, &out);
```
Here is a group of possible hyperparameters: [async-rl/wiki](https://github.com/muupan/async-rl/wiki) , maybe it would help~

After fix this bug, the predict example still fails with msg
```
src/c_api/c_predict_api.cc:171: Check failed: infer_complete The shape information of is not enough to get the shapes
```

@glingyan 
 Yes, MKLML+ATLAS(or MKL) can pass all.
 But the mkl 2017 full package which include the mkl_dnn.h do not contain dnnBatchNormalization_v2 functions based on #3953 

if USE_MKL2017 = 1 & USE_MKL2017_EXPERIMENTAL = 1 & USE_BLAS = mkl
,  the BN functions are heading to /opt/intel/mkl/include/mkl_dnn.h which like these:

```
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardScaleShift_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardData_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);
```

So, in order to solve the dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackward_v2_F32 , I try to make them to ./mklml_lnx_2017.0.2.20161122/include/mkl_dnn.h which like these:


```
 dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardScaleShift_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardData_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_v2_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps,
        unsigned int flags);
dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackward_v2_F32(
        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,
        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,
        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps,
        unsigned int flags);
```

I just want to try to fix it, :)

It is impossible to fixed
Please waiting for mkl’s full package udpate

From: zhouphd [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Thursday, January 5, 2017 10:42 AM
To: dmlc/mxnet <mxnet@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Guo, Lingyan <lingyan.guo@intel.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [dmlc/mxnet] [MakeFile Error] USE_MKL2017 for performance, undefined reference to `dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackward_v2_F32' (#4505)


@glingyan<https://github.com/glingyan>
Yes, MKLML+ATLAS(or MKL) can pass all.
But the mkl 2017 full package which include the mkl_dnn.h do not contain dnnBatchNormalization_v2 functions based on #3953<https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/3953>

if USE_MKL2017 = 1 & USE_MKL2017_EXPERIMENTAL = 1 & USE_BLAS = mkl
, the BN functions are heading to /opt/intel/mkl/include/mkl_dnn.h which like these:

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardScaleShift_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardData_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

So, in order to solve the dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackward_v2_F32 , I try to make them to ./mklml_lnx_2017.0.2.20161122/include/mkl_dnn.h which like these:

 dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardScaleShift_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackwardData_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps);



dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateForward_v2_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps,

        unsigned int flags);

dnnError_t dnnBatchNormalizationCreateBackward_v2_F32(

        dnnPrimitive_t* pBatchNormalization,

        dnnPrimitiveAttributes_t attributes,

        const dnnLayout_t dataLayout, float eps,

        unsigned int flags);

I just want to try to fix it, :)

It would be helpful if you can provide an minimized script that reproduces the issue, so that we can reproduce the problem on our machine. This can be done possibly by removing the data utils, try fix the bucket and see if the code runs. Since this is a purely graph binding problem

Thanks very much for reporting this issue!
The update of `DiagremmeR ` broke several pkgs including `xgboost`.

@howard0su that's a good idea. I could help change this on this branch. I don't have a good idea to handle overflow as well. This is another drawback of the priority approach. It will be good that we could come up with some data structure that will simulate this priority. We could do some brainstorm in the engine refactoring document.

If we all agree this. I will keep this branch for future engine change. And I will close this PR.
Are you sure this fix works? In the issue someone said after the fix gpu inference still doesn't work
It works now. Thanks!

@piiswrong had moved use_nnpack to CreateOp() of convolution operator.

got, it's the same as https://github.com/HIPS/autograd/blob/master/autograd/numpy/numpy_grads.py, 
at the bottom the all op's backward need be done by hand.

but autograd it can differentiate many times as you want.  it's another issue, it hard to be implement in mxnet , to do it i think it need reconstruct the execute graph.
You can use `git submodule update --init` to download submodules.

I roll back to the older non-nnvm version and still have some problems. I add a self define op to process weight
```
x = mx.sym.Varable(name="data")
w = mx.sym.Variable(name="conv_weight", shape=(3, 32, 3, 3))
w = mx.sym.znorm(data=w)
y  = mx.sym.Convolution(data=x, weight=w)
```
This will incur shape infer error in predict api, conv_weight' ndim is 0. However it is ok in python train api when loading previous model to continue training. Removing the line 
```
w = mx.sym.znorm(data=w)
```
the predict example can run normally.
@xzc9180 give me a full  traceback info.
please help to test  #4537 that should solve the problem you are facing.

@xzc9180 this look like Cython can not find msvc. 
Refer to https://github.com/cython/cython/wiki/CythonExtensionsOnWindows

If I understand your problem correctly, you can also use the `--recursive` flag when you clone mxnet to download everything like so:

```bash
git clone --recursive git@github.com:dmlc/mxnet.git
```

https://github.com/dmlc/mshadow/blob/master/mshadow/cuda/tensor_gpu-inl.cuh#L479-L607
(We will do the refactor later)

ok,fixed.

It cannot pass two of them: test_deconvolution() and test_convolution_dilated_impulse_response(), moreover, the function check_deconvolution_forward_backward() gives different results every time I run it, sometimes it passes, sometimes it doesn't (out != args_grad[0].asnumpy()), I'm totally freaking out.

Try to increase worker thread # as well:
export MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS=16
No, my "work-around" so far is to use other frameworks :(
Why large batch_size have better performance
@ydmo I use same method as you, and modify whatisthis to VGG network and do image segmentation task. I can give 5x speedup.

Bug2:
what strange phonemenon!
I have a csv file of ten millions instance, and i make use of these instances to train neural network. I regard CSVIter as iteration of network's inputs. when the same program run in different machines, network's validation's loss are small in one machine and on the contrary network's validation's loss are larger in another machine.
But when i self define csv, the program run in different machines, and the loss are both small.
So the phenomenon above indicates CSVIter exist some bugs.
@hetong007 similar situation with xgboost

yes I've fix the shape in inception model adding a pad of 1 on the last pooling of factoryB. Thanks for sharing. Maybe it's better to fix it also in the master.

I verified in the v0.8 tag and it behaves in the same way of my previous version: less memory and less inference time... It seems that the new backend has some problems..

You can try the example memcost with the inception_memcost.py script or you can refer to this gist:

https://gist.github.com/marcociccone/0028b91e8b9267132195f9bf0ad43463

Update:
I have mapped a few more operators(2D convolution/pooling, map_fn, foldl, foldr, etc) and I am pursuing @tqchen and @piiswrong suggestion of "Compatibility of network graph generation API(without requirement of gradient, and scan) The model fitting logic swapped by module API in mxnet, with API compatibility" for a simple example of "Keras/keras/examples/mnist_mlp.py". The operators are mapped for this example and I am working on using the MXNET module api underneath the Keras Model.fit().
cache efficiency mostly

@piiswrong Yes, Embedding is the same as take(axis=0)

@piiswrong Yes, they are similar in some ways. However, Embedding does not suppor arbitrary weight shape on run-time and needs specifications of the matrix size (which is unkown most of the time). We find take commonly used in detection task and are not satisfied with the performance of pure Python.

Fixed

I found that changing $MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS has no effect on the results. No matter it's 16, 32, or 1, the results are almost the same.

The api has been updated.
I'll deploy the latest scala pkg to maven repository soon.
@howard0su It's ok now, thx
Related to #4525

The memory problem was due to the fact that the parameter gradient get allocated during the graph allocation pass, while they are actually binded by external memory. #4558 Should fix the memory issue.

I have found what the problem leads to that.
I set eps = 1e-5 in BN.
If you set eps >= 2e-5, that will be okay.
Best.

I did not observe significant difference in the cudnn. For predict only task, this could due to the missing bulk execution mode, this is the only known missing piece that is not yet added back.

We can verify by setting environment variable  ```MXNET_EXEC_PREFER_BULK_EXEC=false``` in v0.8 to see if that is the case.
@howard0su both are fixed.
try `dist_sync`?

After reviewing the code, I suggest using the NCHW setting + integrating CuDNN. For the naming of this operator, we can keep the original name in Torch, i.e, "BilinearSampler" https://github.com/qassemoquab/stnbhwd
can you try to merged it into embedding? This is mostly copy pasted code.
@antinucleon
try USE_MKL2017 = 1 in config.mk
